p: From the causes of tree failure reported in the studies of the systematic review, wind is predominantly mentioned to be the prior cause. This is in line with other study results which evaluate that windstorms were responsible for 53% of the total damage in forests over the period of 1850â€“2000 [ 24, 86]. The second most often reported cause of failure are fungi causing decay. Some fungi can cause a die off or break within a relatively short time (e.g. Meripilus giganteus (Pers. ) Karst) [ 87].
